title: Looking up down under
creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University
brief_description:
Episode of Series “Astronomy: an Open Learning unit”.
Telescopes provide our gateway to the stars. The study of astronomy relies heavily on telescopes and has done so for many centuries. Australia is in a unique position for studying the heavens, given its location in the Southern Hemisphere and its relatively small population. This program looks at the history of Astronomy in Australia.
